Dictionary

Animals
1. Elg = Moose
2. Hund = Dog
3. Katt = Cat
4. Isbjørn = Polar bear
5. Sel = Seal
6. Ku = Cow
7. Hest = Horse
8. Rev = Fox
9. Ulv = Wolf
10. Ekorn = Squirrel
Elg
The Moose
The moose is the national animal of Norway. It likes to stay in the wilderness and loves vegetables.
Close
Food
1. Mat = Food
2. Gulrot = Carrot
3. Brød = Bread
4. Kaffe = Coffee
5. Smør = Butter
6. Fisk = Fish
7. Kjøtt = Meat
8. Melk = Milk
9. Ost = Cheese
10. Skinke = Ham
Fish
The cod
Cod = torsk, the cod is the most important fish in Norway. A lot of Norwegians eat the cod every year. It is so important that it is placed on the 200 dollar bill.
Close
Clothing
1. Genser = Sweater
2. Lue = Winter hat
3. Hanske = Glove
4. Jakke = Jacket
5. Sokk = Sock
6. T-skjorte = T-shirt
7. Bukse = Pants
8. Briller = Glasses
9. Sko = Shoe(s)
10. Hatt = Hat
Sweater
Sweater
The most famous sweater in Norway is the "olagenser" as shown in the picture above. It is very good to wear in cold climates.
Close
Housing
1. Bolig = Housing
2. Tak = Ceiling/roof
3. Gulv = Floor
4. Vegg = Wall
5. Vindu = Window
6. Teppe = Carpet
7. Bord = Table
8. Stol = Chair
9. Seng = Bed
10. Pult = Desk
Hus
Hus
The houses in Norway are very solid and warm in during both the summer and the winter. They are beautiful in many colours and sizes.
Close
Kitchen
1. Kjøkken = Kitchen
2. Vask = Sink
3. Stekeovn = Oven
4. Kjøkkenbenk = Kitchen desk
5. Fryser = Freezer
6. Kniv = Knife
7. Skje = Spoon
8. Tallerken = Plate
9. Kjøleskap = Refrigerator
10. Gaffel = Fork
Kitchen
Kitchen
The kitchen in Norway is normally very big and stylish. Norwegians like to have room when making their dinner.
Close
